description: Z-code files use a programming language called the Zork Implementation Language (Zork was Infocom's first game). The file extensions use a numerical value for the version of the Z-machine that is used to run them. Examples include the .Z1 , .Z2 , .Z3 , .Z5 , .Z6 , .Z7 , and .Z8 extensions. Z8 is the most popular extension since it was the last version to be released.
